definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: "Pseudo-mother, " sparked a heated war of words.
sentences.chinese: “僞娘”引發了一場激烈的口水戰。

sentences.english: Do you think spending whole lot of time to wage a spit war with China is meaningful?
sentences.chinese: 你可有想過成天打中國的口水戰有意義嗎？

sentences.english: Eat a peach cut not peeled another north-south netizens slobber war.
sentences.chinese: 喫桃子削不削皮再掀南北網友口水戰。

sentences.english: Moammar Gadhafi's government, for its part, kept up the war of words.
sentences.chinese: 而卡扎菲政府仍然堅持無盡的口水戰。

sentences.english: How do you think of the flame wars between fans of stars?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼看待明星粉絲間的口水戰？

definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
